description: The North American F-86F-35 Sabre is a single-engined, swept-wing, fighter-bomber, and tactical nuclear bomber. The F-86F-35 is similar to the F-86F-25 but the inner left weapon station is reinforced to allow carriage of a Mk 12 nuclear bomb and the aircraft is equipped with the LABS system to allow toss bombing. This variant is the original, with the early slatted wing.
loadnotes: Either stations 1 to 4, or stations 1, 4, and 7 to 10, or stations 5 to 12 may be used.
Stations must be loaded symmetrically, with the exception that a Mk 12 nuclear bomb (weight 1200 lb and load 3.0) may be carried on station 3 (left) with a 120 gal (450L) FT on station 2 (right).
May use 200 gal (760L) FTs on stations 1 and 4 and 120 gal (450L) FTs on stations 2 and 3.
May use two HVAR RKs on each of stations 5 to 12.
